com.threerings.riposte.server
Class PostManager

java.lang.Object
  com.threerings.riposte.server.PostManager

public class PostManager
extends Object

The main server-side class, PostManager is responsible for parsing requests from clients and seeing that the proper PostDispatcher is notified of the service call.

Constructor Detail

PostManager

@Inject
public PostManager(Map<Integer,PostDispatcher> dispatchers,
                          String clientVersion,
                          @Nullable
                          ThreadLocal<String> authLocal)
Constructor for PostManager. PostManager may be Guice injected, or can be constructed by hand. If it is created by Guice, the protected _injector field will be injected by Guice, and then every service method argument will have any transient Inject members added by Guice after the object has been created.

Parameters:
dispatchers - A mapping of service id to the PostDispatcher that's responsible for handling that service's RPC calls.
clientVersion - PostRequest will send along a client-defined version string with every request. If the client and server version strings don't match, a PostException is called to notify the client that it is out of date. If versioning is not required, client and server can both use null for the version string.
authLocal - A ThreadLocal to contain the auth code sent with every request from the client, if it was enabled there. To disable auth code streaming completely, set authCodeAnbled in PostClient to false, and pass in null for authLocal.
Method Detail

doServiceCall

public void doServiceCall(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse rsp)
                   throws IOException
Called by the servlet that is receiving Riposte RPC calls with the raw HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse. The service call data is read from the HttpServletRequest, which is assumed to be binary data encapsulated in a PostRequest at the top level. The method response is written to the HttpServletResponse, or a StreamableError is sent if an exception occurred. If * the exception is a PostException, it is not logged on the server. All other Exceptions are both sent to the client and logged as warnings with the Riposte logger, Log.

Parameters:
req - The servlet request.
rsp - The servlet response.
Throws:
IOException

logServiceException

protected void logServiceException(Exception e,
